sect1.title: IContentCmdletProvider
sect1.para: According to , only HDF5 datasets are considered to have content. PSH5X implements the IContentCmdletProvider interface providing row- or stream-oriented access to a dataset's data elements.

sect2.para: Gets the content of the item at the specified location.
The Get-Content cmdlet gets the content of the item at the location specified by the path, such as the text in a file. It reads the content one line at a time and returns an object for each line.

listitem.para: An HDF5 path name referring to the HDF5 dataset whose content is to be accessed
Specifies how many lines of content are sent through the pipeline at a time. The default value is 1. A value of 0 (zero) sends all of the content at one time.
Specifies how many lines of content are retrieved. The default is -1 (all lines).

example.title: Getting the first 10 elements of a dataset

sect2.para: Writes or replaces the content in an item with new content.

The Set-Content cmdlet is a string-processing cmdlet that writes or replaces the content in the specified item, such as a file. Whereas the Add-Content cmdlet appends content to a file, Set-Content replaces the existing content. You can type the content in the command or send content through the pipeline to Set-Content.

listitem.para: An HDF5 path name referring to the HDF5 dataset whose content is to be accessed
Specifies the new content for the item.

example.title: Setting the content of a dataset from a one- or two-dimensional array
example.screen:
PS:1 > (Get-Item h5tmp:\dset1).Dimensions 10 10 PS:2 > (Get-Item h5tmp:\dset1).ElementType
Name Value ---- ----- SignType 2 BitOffset 0 Class INTEGER MSBitPadding Zero Precision 32 LSBitPadding Zero ByteOrder BE Size 4
PS:3 > $a = New-Object 'int[]' 100 PS:4 > for ($i = 0; $i -lt $a.Length; $i++) { $a[$i] = $i*$i } PS:5 > Set-Content h5tmp:\dset1 $a PS:6 > $b = New-Object 'int[,]' 10,10 PS:7 > for ($i = 0; $i -lt 10; $i++) { $b[$i,$i] = $i } PS:8 > Set-Content h5tmp:\dset1 $b

sect2.para: Adds content to the specified items, such as adding words to a file.
The Add-Content cmdlet appends content to a specified item or file. You can specify the content by typing the content in the command or by specifying an object that contains the content.

listitem.para: Specifies the path to the items that receive the additional content. Wildcards are permitted. If you specify multiple paths, use commas to separate the paths.

Specifies the content to be added. Type a quoted string, such as "This data is for internal use only", or specify an object that contains content, such as the DateTime object that Get-Date generates. You cannot specify the contents of a file by typing its path, because t he path is just a string, but you can use a Get-Content command to get the content and pass it to the Value parameter.
